Foods.title: Yogurt-Berry Parfait
Foods.directions: Wash and dry the berries; hull and cut strawberries into pieces, if using. Spoon a layer of yogurt into 4 individual glass bowls or parfait glasses. Add a layer of berries, and sprinkle with a layer of granola. Repeat the layering once or twice more, depending on the height of the bowl or glass, ending with a layer of granola.
Foods.ingredients 1: 2 to 3 cups mixed berries such as blueberries, strawberries, raspberries, blackberries

Foods.title: Fruit Salad Smoothie
Foods.directions: Blend milk, pineapple, apple, pear, strawberries, cherries, and yogurt together in a blender until smooth, about 4 minutes.
Foods.ingredients 5: 1/4 cup cherries, pitted and chopped, or to taste
Foods.ingredients 6: 2 tablespoons vanilla yogurt, or more to taste

Foods.title: Masala Cabbage Soup
Foods.directions 1: Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir serrano peppers, garlic, and ginger in the hot oil until fragrant, 15 to 20 seconds. Add onion; cook and stir until softened and transparent, 10 to 15 minutes.
Foods.directions 2: Mix potatoes into onion mixture and cook for 2 minutes. Add cabbage and cook for 2 minutes more. Pour chicken stock over cabbage mixture; bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until potatoes are softened, 10 to 15 minutes. Season soup with garam masala and salt.
Foods.directions 3: Pour soup into a blender no more than half full. Cover and hold lid down; pulse a few times before leaving on to blend. Puree in batches until smooth. Return soup to saucepan and cook until warmed, 2 to 3 minutes.
Foods.ingredients 9: 1 teaspoon garam masala, or to taste

Foods.title: Potato Cheese Soup
Foods.directions 1: In a large pot over high heat, combine the potatoes and carrot with water to cover and boil for 10 to 15 minutes, or until tender.
Foods.directions 2: In a separate large skillet over medium heat, saute the celery and onion in the margarine for about 10 minutes.
Foods.directions 3: Drain all but about 2 cups of the water from the potatoes and carrots; add 4 cups milk. Reduce heat to low and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Foods.directions 4: Transfer the onion and celery mixture to the pot and stir in the chicken soup base. Heat slowly, then add the cheese. Allow the cheese to melt, stirring all together well.
Foods.directions 5: In a small bowl, dissolve the cornstarch in the 1/2 cup milk and pour into the soup. Mix well until thickened.

Foods.title: Fire-Roasted Tomato and Pepper Soup
Foods.directions 1: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Line a large sheet pan with parchment paper.
Foods.directions 2: Place peppers, onion and garlic on prepared pan; drizzle with olive oil. Roast in preheated oven until peppers are soft and slightly charred, about 20 minutes.
Foods.directions 3: Add roasted peppers, onions and garlic to the tomato mixture. Using a hand held immersion blender, puree the soup until smooth. Simmer over low heat until hot, about 10 minutes.
Foods.directions 4: Transfer the onion and celery mixture to the pot and stir in the chicken soup base. Heat slowly, then add the cheese. Allow the cheese to melt, stirring all together well.
Foods.directions 5: Serve garnished with Cotija cheese, cilantro and drizzled with lime juice.
Foods.ingredients 1: 4 red or yellow bell peppers, seeded and halved
Foods.ingredients 2: 1 yellow banana pepper, seeded and halved
Foods.ingredients 9: 1 bunch cilantro, chopped, plus leaves for garnish
Foods.ingredients 14: 3 (14.5 ounce) cans Hunt'sÂ® Fire Roasted Diced Tomatoes, undrained
